result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel A. Czaplinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Bond applied, remaining balance to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.   Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.
The defendant shall have no contact with Arran Gertschen, Sabrina Brendle, Tiffany Gagnon or Constance Petschow of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to commence his sentence on or before 07/10/2015 no later than 7:00 p.m.  Huber granted. Defendant was granted 103 days credit for time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, (ALREADY PAID) and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  defendant must maintain abolsute sobriety   Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  The defendant shall have no contact with Arran Gertschen, Sabrina Brendle, Tiffany Gagnon or Constance Petschow of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
